  • sheepdog.globals

sheepdog.globals¶

Contains values for global constants.

ALLOWED_DELETION_STATES = ['validated']¶

This is a list of states that an entity must be in to allow deletion.

ENTITY_STATE_CATEGORIES = ['biospecimen', 'clinical', 'data_file']¶

These categories should all have a state associated with each type

ENTITY_STATE_TRANSITIONS = {'submitted': ['validated', None]}¶

Possible entity.state transitions { to_state: from_state }

ERROR_STATE = 'error'¶

State a file should be put in given an error.

FILE_STATE_KEY = 'file_state'¶

The key that specifies the high level state that a file is in the pipeline

FILE_STATE_TRANSITIONS = {'submitted': ['validated']}¶

Possible data_file.file_state transitions { to_state: from_state }

MESSAGE_500 = 'Internal server error. Sorry, something unexpected went wrong!'¶

Message to provide for internal server errors.

REGEX_UUID = <_sre.SRE_Pattern object>¶

Regex to match a Program or Project uuid.

STATES_COMITTABLE_DRY_RUN = set(['SUCCEEDED'])¶

Allow dry_run transactions to be committed (in a new transaction) if the TransactionLog.state is in the following

STATE_KEY = 'state'¶

The key that specifies the high level state that an entity is in the release process.

SUCCESS_STATE = 'uploaded'¶

State file enters when user completes upload.

TX_LOG_STATE_ERRORED = 'ERRORED'¶

The transaction failed due to system error

TX_LOG_STATE_FAILED = 'FAILED'¶

The transaction failed due to user error

TX_LOG_STATE_PENDING = 'PENDING'¶

The transaction is sill pending or a fatal event ended the job before it could report an ERROR status

TX_LOG_STATE_SUCCEEDED = 'SUCCEEDED'¶

The transaction succeeded without user or system error. If the transaction was a non-dry_run mutation, then the result should be represented in the database

UPLOADING_STATE = 'uploading'¶

State file enters when user begins upload.

case_cache_enabled()¶

Return if the case cache is enabled or not. NOTE that the dictionary must be initialized first!

Note

This function assumes that the dictionary has already been initialized. The except/return None behavior is to, for example, allow Sphinx to still import/run individual modules without raising errors.

submitted_state()¶

Return the initial file state. NOTE that the dictionary must be initialized first!

This would be a global defined as:

SUBMITTED_STATE = (
    dictionary.resolvers['_definitions.yaml'].source['file_state']['default']
)

but the dictionary must be initialized first, so this value cannot be used before that.

Note

This function assumes that the dictionary has already been initialized. The except/return None behavior is to, for example, allow Sphinx to still import/run individual modules without raising errors.
